channel.title: Comments on: How to pad positive and negative number with zeroes in SQL Server?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Paulo AMF
item.dc:creator: Paulo AMF
item.description: Exists a problem: Negative number now have 10bytes. To solve change '' to '0'.<br /> <br />
item.content:encoded: Exists a problem: Negative number now have 10bytes. To solve change ” to ‘0’.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Vadivel, so did I in 2005

http://sqlservercode.blogspot.com/2005/11/pad-numbers-by-using-case-left-and.html

i just added the minus part today since someone asked how that would work

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.description: Nice post. I'm always (re)discovering default behavior in SQL.<br /> (Like the necessity of converting an int to a varchar before concatenating the leading zeroes).
item.content:encoded:
Nice post. I’m always (re)discovering default behavior in SQL.
(Like the necessity of converting an int to a varchar before concatenating the leading zeroes).
